page.title: 06ST NICHOLAS CHURCH,HOCKLIFFE
page.content: The small church commands{a dominant {position on a steep sided spur.} It is made from local materials such as Totternhoe stone and ironstone.{ St. {Nicholas's Hockliffe}was built in the {14th century,}although it's first {vicar}is recorded in 1217. Additions were made in the{15th century {including the tower. }In {1910}the tower was repaired by public subscription. There is a small aisle on the left, in which the{Lord {of the Manor}would sit with his wife and children. They even had the privilege of a private entrance. Of interest is the Gilpin vault.{1985}the church has{regular services,}although the congregation only numbers about twelve. Unfortunately the church no longer has its own vicar. Instead a{curate}from{Leighton Buzzard's {church}takes the services.
